paragraph.value: Overall the SVM with polynomial degree 1 kernel

paragraph.expression: let compareToSvmLinearP columnName = overallComparison (map (compareCols "svm1_p" columnName) tableData) in underOverPerformed (overallComparison [compareToSvmLinearP c | c <- ["naive_bayes_p", "svm2_p", "svm3_p", "svmr_p"]])

paragraph.value: all other kernels with other kernels generally offering

paragraph.expression: let compareToSvmLinearP columnName = overallComparison (map (compareCols "svm1_p" columnName) tableData) in betterWorse (overallComparison [compareToSvmLinearP c | c <- ["naive_bayes_p", "svm2_p", "svm3_p", "svmr_p"]])

let compareToSvmLinearR columnName = overallComparison (map (compareCols columnName "svm1_r" ) tableData) in betterWorse (overallComparison [compareToSvmLinearR c | c <- ["naive_bayes_r", "svm2_r", "svm3_r", "svmr_r"]])

paragraph.value: cost to recall. Precision (Positive predictive) values ranged from
for NB. Recall (sensitivity) values ranged from
for NB. SVM tended to offer

paragraph.expression: let compareToNBP columnName = overallComparison (map (compareCols columnName "naive_bayes_p" ) tableData) in aReducedIncreased (overallComparison [compareToNBP c | c <- ["svm1_p", "svm2_p", "svm3_p", "svmr_p"]])

let compareToNBR columnName = overallComparison (map (compareCols columnName "naive_bayes_r" ) tableData) in betterWorse (overallComparison [compareToNBR c | c <- ["svm1_r", "svm2_r", "svm3_r", "svmr_r"]])

paragraph.value: recall. In the case of one syndrome (Hemorrhagic) we noticed an

paragraph.expression: let hem = findWithKey_ "synd" "Hem." tableData; let compareToHemNBR columnName = compareCols columnName "naive_bayes_r" hem in unusuallyHighLow (overallComparison [compareToHemNBR c | c <- ["svm1_r", "svm2_r", "svm3_r", "svmr_r"]])

paragraph.value: level of recall for SVM but not for NB.
